page.title: 11Blocks D2_D4
page.content: {Block D2.}An area of scattered farms, one of which,Cilcarw Uchaf, has close connections with Hywel Harries, one of the leaders of the Welsh Methodist Revival.The area is drained by Afon Berem,the river from which the village according to local tradition derives its' name (bridge on the Berem).{Block {D3.}An area of scattered farmsteads and of compact residential dwellings. The South_eastern part of the area is traversed by the old parish road from Pontyberem Station to Capel Seion.The private dwellings are of comparatively recent construction{BLOCK D4}Primarily an area of rough pasture-land and of scattered farmsteads.It is disected by a continuation of the road to Capel Seion.In the lower half of the area can be seen the remains of Glynhebog Colliery reputed to have been the worst colliery in the Gwendraeth Fawr
